intro: Schismatoglottis elongata, commonly known as the elongated schismatoglottis, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its broad, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in a loose inflorescence. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Schismatoglottis elongata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
